meta_summary: These groups primarily focus on logistical arrangements for the Solid Practitioners meetings, including scheduling, time zone confirmations, and sharing meeting links, agendas, recordings and notes.  A recurring theme is ensuring accessibility to meeting materials and resolving any technical difficulties that arise, as well as rotating scribing duties and addressing gender balance in note-taking responsibilities.
sample_group_titles: Standardizing Solid Project Matrix Space Links and Channel Inclusion
Routine Meeting Coordination and Logistics
Practitioner Working Group Meeting Logistics and Scheduling
Coordination and Scheduling for Solid Practitioners Meetings
Implementing and Configuring the Solid Practitioners Reminder Bot
Solid Practitioners Feb 5 Meeting Logistics and Schedule Conflict Resolution
Practitioners Meeting Logistics and Future Agenda
Solid Practitioners Meeting Schedule Confirmation
Discussion of Practitioners Group Meeting Time and Cadence
Logistics and Agenda Setting for August 7th Practitioners Meeting

meta_summary: These conversations center around the development and coordination of Solid web components.  Discussions include planning meetups, addressing technical challenges like reactive rendering and interoperability, and announcing new tools and components, such as a CSS component scaffolder and an SSO authentication bridge.
sample_group_titles: Planning and Technical Discussion for Solid Web Components Group
Coordination for Solid Web Components Meetup
SSO Authentication Bridge for Solid Apps (CSS Component)
Announcement of CSS Component Scaffolder Tool

meta_summary: These groups focus on strategies for indexing and searching data within Solid applications. They cover topics such as standardizing search APIs, designing federated geosearch architectures using Community Pods, and exploring different indexing mechanisms. They also include the management of meetings dedicated to search, as well as call for papers regarding the topic.
sample_group_titles: Solid Data Indexing Strategies and Standardization
Management and Follow-up for the February 19th Search Meeting
Architectural Design for Federated Geosearch using Community Pods
Indexing and Searching Use Case Homework
Search Capabilities in Solid Applications
Call for Papers for DESERE 2025 Workshop

meta_summary: The conversations here revolve around the governance and strategic direction of the Solid Practitioners Group. Discussions encompass the group's role within the broader Solid ecosystem and the Open Data Institute (ODI), including charter development, co-chair elections, and participation in the ODI Solid Advisory Committee.  Ethical considerations regarding monetization strategies are also debated.
sample_group_titles: Debate on Solid Practitioners Strategy and Monetization Ethics
Practitioners Group Role in ODI Governance, Charter, and Elections
Feedback and Nominations for ODI Governance Committees
Solid Practitioners Group Co-Chair Elections
Revised Solid Practitioners Group Scope and Governance
October Practitioners Meeting Announcement and Agenda
Announcement of ODI Solid Advisory Committee Meeting

meta_summary: This topic cluster focuses on Solid notifications and webhooks. Discussions cover implementation experiences with different Pod providers, challenges with server standardization and notification limitations, as well as the creation of a dedicated chat channel for Real Time Solid (RTS) efforts. It also includes scheduling and feedback related to Practitioners meetings specifically addressing these topics.
sample_group_titles: Solid Practitioners Biweekly Meeting Schedule and Hiatus
Establishing a Chat Channel for Real Time Solid (RTS)
Solid Practitioners Meeting: Jan 22 Logistics, Minutes, and Initial Feedback
Discussion on Solid Notifications Implementation and Pod Support

meta_summary: These conversations centered on improving Solid onboarding and education. One group explored using a GPT agent trained on Solid information, while another focused on creating explainer content and establishing a dedicated chat room for explaining Solid's practical applications, including coordinating with the W3C Community Group 'Solid Explainer' initiative.
sample_group_titles: Solid Explainer Content and Onboarding Strategy
Experimenting with Solid GPT Agent

meta_summary: These discussions revolved around Solid Application Interoperability (SAI), covering topics like user profile data handling with PII, access control UX for Solid applications, and clarification of the SAI specification. There was also discussion contrasting the 'everything app' approach with specialized apps using interop and sharing architecture-as-code tools for Solid architecture.
sample_group_titles: User Profile, PII Handling, and Access Control UX for Solid Applications
Clarification and Resource Sharing for Solid Application Interoperability (SAI)
Anytype, Local-First, and Generic vs. Specialized App Strategy
Sharing Architecture-as-Code Tool (LikeC4)

meta_summary: The focus of these discussions was on defining data shapes and ontologies within Solid. This included defining a common shape for products and services, collaborating on SHACL shapes and ontologies for specific applications like products and services, and discussing interoperability and data fetching using shapes, leading to the creation of a centralized Solid Shapes wiki and catalog.
sample_group_titles: Defining Shapes and Schema for Products and Services
Collaboration on Linked Data Shapes
Collaboration on SHACL, Ontologies, and RDF Ecosystem Description

meta_summary: These conversations covered various aspects of Solid server implementations. This included proposals for a Server Practitioners subgroup, troubleshooting Node Solid Server (NSS) deployments, discussing infrastructure migration from NSS to PIVOT, and a comparison of Synovient and open-source Solid Pods.
sample_group_titles: Proposal for Server Practitioners Subgroup and Feedback on Meeting Notes
Node Solid Server (NSS) Deployment Troubleshooting
Comparison of Synovient and Solid Pods
Solid Infrastructure Migration and Solid World Call for Speakers

meta_summary: These discussions focused on standardizing aspects of Solid-OIDC (OpenID Connect). One conversation centered on standardizing Solid-OIDC provider metadata to improve user experience during login, while another discussed standardizing WebID document information for Pod providers to improve UI consistency.
sample_group_titles: Proposal for Standardizing Solid-OIDC Provider Metadata
Standardizing Pod Provider WebID Document Information

meta_summary: Discussions revolved around setting up and debugging a group pod on TrinPod, specifically addressing issues related to WebID parsing and adding members. The group also explored how TrinPod manages access and privacy for group pods through the use of private triples within user's personal pods for application discovery.
sample_group_titles: Setting up the Practitioners Group Pod on TrinPod
TrinPod Group Pod Discovery Mechanism and Privacy

meta_summary: These conversations focused on strategies and tools for localizing Solid projects, evaluating options like Project Fluent, Vue i18n, and Weblate for community-driven translations. Participants also shared technical examples of internationalization using Wikidata for RDF data negotiation.
sample_group_titles: Localization Strategy and Tooling (Fluent/Weblate)
Localization Meeting Tools and RDF Data Discussion

meta_summary: The groups explored the integration of ActivityPub with Solid, including discussions on inbox validation and the potential for new abstractions. Participants shared meeting recaps, videos, and discussed the viability of different approaches, ultimately favoring the ActivityPods architecture.
sample_group_titles: Solid/ActivityPub Integration Meeting Recap and Client Limitations
ActivityPub Integration, Inbox Validation, and Abstraction Use Cases

meta_summary: These groups consist of introductions and welcomes for new community members, with participants sharing their backgrounds, organizational affiliations (or lack thereof), and expressing enthusiasm for Solid.  Announcements, acknowledgements, and inquiries about Solid-related events and resources also appear frequently.
sample_group_titles: Initial Greetings and Reactions
Organizational Affiliation and Solid Group Membership
Welcome and Initial Introductions
Miscellaneous Announcements and Introductions
General Chat and Acknowledgement

meta_summary: These conversations center around funding opportunities for Solid projects, with requests for transatlantic collaboration for NGI Sargasso grant applications. There was also an inquiry into ODI's distribution plan for a new Solid grant, seeking clarity on how funds would be allocated across different stakeholders.
sample_group_titles: NGI Grant Application and Future Presentations
Funding Opportunities and Collaboration Request
Inquiry into ODI Solid Grant Distribution Plan

meta_summary: These discussions center on Sleepy Bike, a hospitality exchange project, including its relationship to WarmShowers and geographic scope. Participants also shared background information on the history of hospitality exchange communities, highlighting potential pitfalls and alternative networks like OpenHospitalityNetwork.
sample_group_titles: Welcome to Mariha and Sleepy Bike Introduction
Inquiry into Sleepy Bike Geographic Scope and WarmShowers Relationship
Background on Hospitality Exchange Communities

meta_summary: One focus is on job searching, with participants sharing resources and announcements of availability within the Solid community. Additionally, there were announcements regarding open positions at ODI for Solid-related roles, specifically mentioning a preference for candidates in London.
sample_group_titles: ODI Hiring for Solid Roles
Job Search and Resource Sharing

meta_summary: Discussions involved general feedback about the recent Solid World event, with participants sharing greetings and project updates. The recording and slides from the June Solid World event were also shared, including a higher-quality slide deck for NextGraph.
sample_group_titles: Greetings and General Solid World Feedback
Sharing Solid World June Recording and Slides

meta_summary: An announcement was made regarding the launch of the Oracle Aconex Accelerator, integrating Solid technology into Construction technology.
sample_group_titles: Announcement of Oracle Aconex Accelerator Launch

meta_summary: A conflict arose regarding the SolidCouch repository ownership and license changes, leading to the conflict being referred to the CoC Committee, followed by a memberâ€™s departure and confirmation that CoC reporting is now handled by ODI Ombuds.
sample_group_titles: SolidCouch Conflict and Code of Conduct Committee Status

meta_summary: These groups focus on restructuring the Solid Catalog, separating data from applications and moving it to its own repository. Discussions include the new frontend interface, search implementation, the inclusion of research papers, V2 testing and persistence strategy, the definition of metadata predicates, repository governance, form development, and general maintenance.
sample_group_titles: Solid Catalog Form Development and Metadata Definition
Solid Catalog V2 Testing and Persistence Strategy
Catalog Update, Repository Governance, and Shapes Versioning
Repository Branch Cleanup and Creation of Dedicated Catalog Management Channel
Defining the 'landingPage' Predicate in Catalog V2
New Solid Catalog Frontend Interface and Search Implementation
Including Research Papers in Solid Catalog
Restructuring the Solid Catalog Repository
Catalogue Data Correction for Oxford Entries
Confirming Catalog Updates and New Specifications

meta_summary: Jeff Zucker facilitated an introduction between two members interested in discussing the application and policies of Solid technology within the context of the Mexican government.
sample_group_titles: Connecting Developers for Solid in Mexico

meta_summary: Participants discussed the current lack of standardized server-side pagination methods in Solid for handling large datasets like chat logs, noting existing workarounds and limitations regarding document vs. triple level operations.
sample_group_titles: Challenges of Server-Side Pagination in Solid

meta_summary: A member declined an invitation to join the W3C Solid Community Group due to time constraints, leading to a clarification that the Practitioners group prioritizes active project work over general Solid happenings.
sample_group_titles: Scope of External Solid Involvement

meta_summary: The conversation debated the use of acl:trustedApp as a historical workaround for global app access, noting that current server implementations handle authorization differently and mentioning SAI as an alternative direction.
sample_group_titles: Discussion on Trusted Apps and Authorization Alternatives

meta_summary: Participants discussed and agreed to share information about the Solid Data Modules project on wedistribute.org.
sample_group_titles: Sharing Solid Data Modules on wedistribute.org

meta_summary: A participant requested a link and information about the 'Solid Compound' project, which focuses on improving UX and DX, and the relevant GitHub link was provided.
sample_group_titles: Request for Information and Link to Solid Compound Project

meta_summary: A newcomer sought advice for building a Proof of Concept (PoC) for career data management, leading to community recommendations favoring the Community Solid Server (CSS), Javascript/Typescript, and guidance on ontology and interoperability conventions.
sample_group_titles: Guidance for Building a Solid Career Data Management PoC

meta_summary: An announcement was made regarding Solvent, a project enabling Solid applications to run natively over a user's file system using Manas and Tauri.
sample_group_titles: Announcement of Solvent: Native Solid Apps over Filesystem

meta_summary: The discussions covered RDF tooling for JavaScript, including scheduled presentations and past practitioner meetings featuring demos of tools like SAI and LDO.js. Some focus was on the status of RDF library support in languages like Python and Perl, as well as data transparency and the use of linked data in the context of Large Language Models (LLMs).
sample_group_titles: Tools and Libraries Practitioner Meeting (May 13)
Scheduling RDF JavaScript Tooling Overview
LLM Data Transparency, Consent, and Linked Data
Notes on RDF Libraries in Python and Perl

meta_summary: These discussions center around the expansion and federation of Solid forums. They include the launch of a new federated forum using ActivityPub and NodeBB, along with increased engagement and cross-invitation from Spanish-speaking members within the Solid Podspace forum.
sample_group_titles: Solid Forum Thread on Podspace and Spanish Speakers
Launch of Federated Forum on We Distribute

meta_summary: Rahul asked for bike hiring advice in Paris, receiving a referral to the sleepy.bike Matrix room, later confirming the trip was over.
sample_group_titles: Request for Paris Bike Hiring Advice

meta_summary: These discussions focus on improving Solid development resources and developer experience. Participants are requesting inspiring resources for new developers and offering feedback on the poor quality and outdated state of official Solid documentation, especially from Inrupt, while praising community resources.
sample_group_titles: Seeking Inspiring Solid Development Resources
Feedback on Solid Developer Experience and Documentation Quality

meta_summary: A single link to a Gitter hackathon room was posted without context.
sample_group_titles: Isolated Chat Room Link

meta_summary: Mariha updated the community on the difficult internal situation of the sleepy.bike project, confirming a 'schism' resulting in two incomplete, one-person teams.
sample_group_titles: Sleepy.bike Project Experiences Internal Schism

meta_summary: A developer shared a resource summarizing challenges and practices concerning Solid interoperability and invited discussion on the Solid forum.
sample_group_titles: Solid Interoperability and Practices

meta_summary: A non-technical startup from Australia introduced themselves, expressing interest in integrating Solid Pods and seeking connections with local experts or Inrupt for collaboration.
sample_group_titles: Australian Startup Introduction and Collaboration Inquiry

meta_summary: Mohammad Bahrani from the University of Southampton introduced his research project focused on efficient, secure, and sovereign search over Solid pods using LLMs and Federated Learning.
sample_group_titles: Introduction of Researcher on Solid Search and LLMs

meta_summary: These discussions revolve around proposals and announcements for the upcoming Solid Symposium. Topics include organizing an international panel focusing on diverse applications of Solid and promoting specific sessions such as 'Solid Together' (for societal good projects) and the ESPRESSO workshop (for decentralized search).
sample_group_titles: SoSy 2025 Sessions: Solid Together and ESPRESSO Decentralized Search
Proposal for Solid Symposium International Panel

meta_summary: Links were shared referencing a W3C public-solid email announcing the scheduling of a meeting focused on Conflict-free Replicated Data Types (CRTDs) in Solid.
sample_group_titles: CRTDs Meeting Scheduling

meta_summary: A request was made to community members to contribute their Solid projects and use cases to a list on the Solid forum to demonstrate Solid in action.
sample_group_titles: Call for Real-World Solid Use Cases

meta_summary: This group contains two independent announcements: an invitation to participate in a Solid panel discussion at the State of Open Con conference, and a link to a survey regarding SHACL shapes.
sample_group_titles: Upcoming Events and Surveys

meta_summary: Participants discussed the feasibility of creating a Solid adapter for Anthropic's Model Context Protocol (MCP), debating how MCP and RAG approaches differ concerning data querying, local data manipulation, and the privacy risks associated with LLM training on user data.
sample_group_titles: Solid Integration with Model Context Protocol (MCP) and LLM Privacy

meta_summary: The conversation covered troubleshooting issues with Mastopod, coordinating a switch of Peertube hosting instances, and offering general recommendations for various Fediverse services and clients like Mastodon, Lemmy, and Pixelfed.
sample_group_titles: Fediverse Tools and Deployment

meta_summary: Participants discussed organizing non-competitive Solid hackathons focused on specific projects like PASS and sleepy.bike, establishing preliminary goals and structure requirements, and reflecting on the competitive nature of such events.
sample_group_titles: Solid Hackathon Planning and Format

meta_summary: The discussion explored the utility of Group WebIDs versus URIs for access control, particularly addressing the challenge of authorizing access to resources based on private group membership lists (e.g., foaf:Group or vcard:Group) without making the member list public.
sample_group_titles: Group WebIDs, ACLs, and Private Group Membership

meta_summary: Following a discussion on cryptographic keys, an accepted standard (RFC 9421) for message signing was introduced, prompting planning for a future dedicated meeting in March to discuss its application within Solid.
sample_group_titles: Follow-up on Private Keys and Message Signing Standard

meta_summary: These conversations focus on improving the discoverability and cataloging of Solid applications and resources within the ecosystem. Participants are discussing the creation of an RDF description for the Solid ecosystem, requesting additions to the Solid catalog, and clarifying the current status of Solid app listings.
sample_group_titles: Solid App Discoverability and Status
Introduction to Solid Ecosystem RDF Description Project
Request for Solid Blogs and Sites for Catalog Inclusion

meta_summary: These discussions are centered on Solid governance and community initiatives. One topic is promoting meetings regarding proposed changes in Solid project governance, while the other involves discussing a CG proposal exploring how Solid can support censorship resistance and protect user privacy.
sample_group_titles: Solid Governance and ODI Meeting Promotion
Discussion of CG Proposal on Censorship and Privacy

meta_summary: These discussions centered on authentication and authorization within the Solid ecosystem. Topics included identifying UMA flow implementations in Solid Pods, harmonizing authentication specifications through short-term meetings, and addressing the challenges of authenticating non-web applications.
sample_group_titles: Follow-up on Auth Spec Harmonization and STM Planning
Authentication for Non-Web Applications
Searching for UMA Flow Implementations in Solid Pods

meta_summary: An announcement is shared regarding FediCon, an event focused on the Open Social Web, inviting projects for various social protocols.
sample_group_titles: FediCon Announcement for Open Social Web

meta_summary: This topic cluster addressed challenges related to Solid data and technology. Discussions ranged from concerns regarding consent and data control in external health data aggregation initiatives to questions about network security and loop prevention in decentralized social queries.
sample_group_titles: Addressing Security and Loop Prevention in Social Queries
Discussion on External Health Data Aggregation Plans

meta_summary: Members share resources on binary RDF formats like Jelly RDF, HDT, and CBOR-LD, discussing historical usage, performance issues, and potential solutions like streaming protocols.
sample_group_titles: Discussion on Binary RDF Formats (HDT, CBOR-LD) and Performance

meta_summary: These groups focused on the integration and compatibility of ActivityPods within the Solid ecosystem. Discussions included technical aspects such as group pods, ActivityPub implementation over Solid, ODRL, RDF document structure and sharing reports detailing adaptation challenges.
sample_group_titles: ActivityPods Presentation and Technical Discussion
ActivityPods Compatibility Report Sharing

meta_summary: A user inquired about a dedicated room for discussing Web Access Control (WAC) and was directed to the general Solid specification channel.
sample_group_titles: Location for WAC Discussions

meta_summary: The conversations here revolved around PeerTube and video hosting related to Solid. This included discussions about a new Solid Practitioners PeerTube channel, content uploading, hosting strategies, licensing, and logistics for sharing transportation meeting recordings.
sample_group_titles: Solid Practitioners PeerTube Channel and Platform Sustainability
Transportation Meeting Recording Upload Logistics

meta_summary: A user announced the release of a program to extract DICOM metadata as RDF for querying pathology and radiology data stored in Solid PODs.
sample_group_titles: DICOM Metadata to RDF Converter Tool

meta_summary: The Contacts client-client spec group sought feedback from practitioners regarding the feasibility of migrating from `vcard:AddressBook` to `foaf:AddressBook`, acknowledging the need for backward compatibility support over several years.
sample_group_titles: Solid Contacts Spec Migration Discussion

meta_summary: Members shared mixed feedback on the utility and security of GenAI code editors/copilots, discussing both positive formatting capabilities and negative experiences involving bugs and potential security vulnerabilities.
sample_group_titles: Discussion on AI Code Generation Effectiveness

meta_summary: This topic covered miscellaneous announcements and discussions relevant to Solid. These included product updates, news about bridges, mailing list confirmations, workshop announcements, and clarification regarding the relationship between Solid and Linked Web Storage (LWS).
sample_group_titles: Miscellaneous Announcements and Technical Updates
Miscellaneous Greetings and Resource Sharing

meta_summary: Users reported difficulties accessing resources due to broken links resulting from the Inrupt migration, including a Solid Symposium page and the Real Time Solid website, with the page owner acknowledging the issue.
sample_group_titles: Broken Inrupt Migration Links

meta_summary: These conversations centered on the use of Datasolids in the context of HIPAA compliance. Participants debated whether Datasolids' architecture, particularly its approach to data silos and abstraction layers, aligns with both HIPAA security requirements and the broader principles of Solid interoperability, with discussions emphasizing that compliance is heavily process-dependent.
sample_group_titles: Datasolids Architecture, Security, and Solid Protocol Adherence
Enterprise Solid Security, Interoperability, and HIPAA Compliance

meta_summary: Participants discussed the MANDAT project, focusing on its advanced Solid capabilities like organizational delegation and data provision chains, and sought clarification on the underlying legal and high-level requirements for bank/SMB use cases versus technical implementation details.
sample_group_titles: MANDAT Project Requirements, Delegation, and Architecture

meta_summary: The group shared the video recording of recent presentations and posed follow-up questions regarding technical details of PodQuest, specifically WebID scoped indexes and open-sourcing the application.
sample_group_titles: Post-Presentation Follow-up and Technical Queries

meta_summary: Participants shared various external links and resources related to Solid and related technologies. This included links to web servers (MyceliumWebServer), blog posts explaining Data Wallets, ODRL examples for agent delegation, workshops on geo data and AI control, news articles on data leaks, and articles on graph security.
sample_group_titles: External Links, ODRL, and Quick Queries

meta_summary: These conversations focused on the readiness and maturity of Solid for production use. The debate covered Solid's data sovereignty benefits against centralized solutions, with perspectives ranging from viewing Solid as being in an 'alpha test period' to recognizing it as a practical platform suitable for application development today.
